title: Increasing Efficiency at the Office of the Federal Register

enrichment.summary: This executive order directs the Office of the Federal Register and related agencies to reduce delays and cut costs in publishing federal regulations by modernizing systems and streamlining processes. It also requires reports on publication times and fee schedules to ensure fees reflect actual costs and improvements made. The goal is to support deregulation efforts and save taxpayer money by making the publication process more efficient.
potential_concerns: Delays in implementing technology upgrades could slow expected efficiency gains.
Reduced publication fees might decrease revenue available for Federal Register operations, impacting quality or staffing.
Streamlining bureaucracy may inadvertently reduce necessary procedural checks or oversight, risking errors.
Faster publication times could pressure agencies to rush document finalization, potentially affecting document accuracy or completeness.
Complexity in accurately linking fees to real costs and efficiencies could create disputes or administrative burdens.
